option.name: title_text
option.value: Accessibility 101: Ensuring Your Course is Accessible to All

string_table.name: pxabnsnfns10111111101
string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.

slidelink.displaytext: How Do I Make My Class Accessible?

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

resource.title: National Center on Accessible Educational Materials
WCAG 101: Understanding the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: <Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="I will use a four quadrant board and sticky notes to organize the how to tips according to the POUR Principle they support. Now I just have to place each tip onto the correct quadrant. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="That was challenging! I better pause here and review the principles and how to tips before I begin revising my course." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

terms.term: The measure of a web page's usability by persons with a disability.
Print- and technology-based educational materials that are designed to be usable across a wide range of disabilities
Various formats, such as braille, large print and digital text, that provide the same information as a text-based material.
Includes hardware devices and software that provide learners with access to content in an accessible digital format
Short text used to describe images, usually in 125 characters or less.
Technology designed to address specific barriers that learners with disabilities may face. Text-to-speech readers, screen readers, and speech recognition are examples of assistive technology.
Disability defined by a decrease in ability or total inability to hear.
A broad spectrum of conditions that make it difficult for people to perform one or more types of mental tasks than the average person.
A limitation in ability. Disabilities can be visual, auditory, cognitive, or motor impairments.
Impairments, limitations or characteristics that limit or prevent independent movementor full use of a body part(s).

Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act's purpose is to eliminate barriers to information technology for individuals with a disability. The law applies to all Federal agencies and includes institutions that receive federal finding.
A decreased ability to see or a total lack of vision.

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines are the international standard for web content accessibility. The guidelines are organized into four principles: perceivable, operable, understandable, and robust.
